alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 13 at 1:52PM MDT until June 14 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Rain is ending today and most of the snow has melted, but water on mountain streams and creeks is running high and may cause flooding along low spots in the mountains and foothills. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT MDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of south central Montana, including the following county, Big Horn. Portions of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until midnight MDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 149 PM MDT, Recent rain and melting snow will keep creeks and rivers running high. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dayton, Big Horn, Parkman, Ranchester, Wyola, Banner and Crow Indian Reservation. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings.
